TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit ReadOnlyCollection`1<T> extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1<!T>, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<!T>, class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<!T>, class System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection`1<!T>, class System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList`1<!T>, class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Collections.IList
Public Class ReadOnlyCollection(Of T) Implements ICollection(Of T), IEnumerable(Of T), IList, IList(Of T), IReadOnlyCollection(Of T), IReadOnlyList(Of T)

generic <typename T> public ref class ReadOnlyCollection : System::Collections::Generic::ICollection<T>, System::Collections::Generic::IEnumerable<T>, System::Collections::Generic::IList<T>, System::Collections::Generic::IReadOnlyCollection<T>, System::Collections::Generic::IReadOnlyList<T>, System::Collections::IList

span.span: The type of elements in the collection.

summary.span: 提供泛型只读集合的基类。

span.span: Provides the base class for a generic read-only collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 实例泛型类始终是只读的。An instance of the generic class is always read-only. 集合是只读的是只是一个集合与防止集合; 进行修改的包装因此，如果对基础集合进行更改，只读集合将反映这些更改。A collection that is read-only is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents modifying the collection; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, the read-only collection reflects those changes. 请参阅此类的可修改版本。See for a modifiable version of this class. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示了多个成员类。The following code example demonstrates several members of the class. 此代码示例创建的字符串，并向其中添加四个不复存在名称。The code example creates a of strings and adds four dinosaur names to it. 下面的代码示例然后包装的列表中。The code example then wraps the list in a . 后演示， ， ，和成员，代码示例显示，是仅适用于原始包装通过添加新项到和显示的内容。After demonstrating the , , , and members, the code example shows that the is just a wrapper for the original by adding a new item to the and displaying the contents of the . 最后，代码示例创建一个数组大于集合在指定的位置，并使用方法将集合中的元素插入到数组的中间。Finally, the code example creates an array larger than the collection and uses the method to insert the elements of the collection into the middle of the array. [!code-cpp[generic.ReadOnlyCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/generic.ReadOnlyCollection/cpp/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[generic.ReadOnlyCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/generic.ReadOnlyCollection/cs/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[generic.ReadOnlyCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/generic.ReadOnlyCollection/vb/source.vb#1)]

threadsafe.span: 公共静态 (在 Visual Basic 中) 的此类型的成员都是线程安全。

span.span: Public static ( in Visual Basic) members of this type are thread safe.

threadsafe.span: 但不保证所有实例成员都是线程安全的。

span.span: Any instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe.

threadsafe.span: A同时，可以支持多个读取器，只要不修改该集合。

span.span: A can support multiple readers concurrently, as long as the collection is not modified.

threadsafe.span: 即便如此，枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。

span.span: Even so, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.

threadsafe.span: 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。

span.span: To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration.

threadsafe.span: 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。

span.span: To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization.

para.span: 此基类用于轻松实现器来创建泛型只读的自定义集合。

span.span: This base class is provided to make it easier for implementers to create a generic read-only custom collection.

para.span: 建议来扩展此基类的类，而不是创建其自己的实施者。

span.span: Implementers are encouraged to extend this base class instead of creating their own.

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例，该实例是指定列表周围的只读包装。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class that is a read-only wrapper around the specified list.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要防止对`list`，公开`list`只通过此包装器。To prevent any modifications to `list`, expose `list` only through this wrapper. 集合是只读的是只是一个集合与防止集合; 进行修改的包装因此，如果对基础集合进行更改，只读集合将反映这些更改。A collection that is read-only is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents modifying the collection; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, the read-only collection reflects those changes. 此构造函数是 o （1） 操作。This constructor is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示此构造函数和多个成员类。The following code example demonstrates this constructor and several members of the class. 此代码示例创建的字符串，并向其中添加四个不复存在名称。The code example creates a of strings and adds four dinosaur names to it. 下面的代码示例然后包装的列表中通过将其传递给构造函数。The code example then wraps the list in a by passing it to the constructor. 后演示， ， ，和成员，代码示例显示，是仅适用于原始包装通过添加新项到和显示的内容。After demonstrating the , , , and members, the code example shows that the is just a wrapper for the original by adding a new item to the and displaying the contents of the . 最后，代码示例创建一个数组大于集合在指定的位置，并使用方法将集合中的元素插入到数组的中间。Finally, the code example creates an array larger than the collection and uses the method to insert the elements of the collection into the middle of the array. MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1<!T> GetEnumerator() cil managed
Public Function GetEnumerator () As IEnumerator(Of T)

summary.span: 返回循环访问 的枚举数。

span.span: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the .
An for the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` Visual c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏了枚举数的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in Visual C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 之前， 返回相同的对象。 returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过的末尾的集合，枚举数定位在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置上，后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 无法再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素；必须改为创建新的枚举器实例。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator instance instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举数将失效且不可恢复，而且其行为是不确定的。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 集合中的默认实现不同步。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用枚举器显示的内容包装。The following code example uses the enumerator to display the contents of a that wraps a . 枚举器隐藏由`foreach`语句 (`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中， `for each` c + + 中)。The enumerator is concealed by the `foreach` statement (`For Each` in Visual Basic, `for each` in C++). [!code-cpp[generic.ReadOnlyCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/generic.ReadOnlyCollection/cpp/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[generic.ReadOnlyCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/generic.ReadOnlyCollection/cs/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[generic.ReadOnlyCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/generic.ReadOnlyCollection/vb/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 搜索向前从第一个元素开始和结束时间的最后一个元素。The is searched forward starting at the first element and ending at the last element. 此方法可确定使用默认比较器的相等性。This method determines equality using the default comparer . 此方法执行的线性搜索;因此，此方法为 O (`n`) 操作，其中`n`是。This method performs a linear search; therefore, this method is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is .

The element at the specified index.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性提供能够通过使用下面的 C# 语法来访问集合中的特定元素： `myCollection[index]` (`myCollection(index)`在 Visual Basic 中)。This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following C# syntax: `myCollection[index]` (`myCollection(index)` in Visual Basic). C# 语言使用关键字进行定义而不是实现索引器属性。The C# language uses the keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the property. Visual Basic 将 实现为默认属性，该属性提供相同的索引功能。Visual Basic implements as a default property, which provides the same indexing functionality. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示了多个成员类。The following code example demonstrates several members of the class. 此代码示例创建的字符串，并向其中添加四个不复存在名称。The code example creates a of strings and adds four dinosaur names to it. 下面的代码示例然后包装的列表中。The code example then wraps the list in a . 后演示， ， ，和成员，代码示例显示，是仅适用于原始包装通过添加新项到和显示的内容。After demonstrating the , , , and members, the code example shows that the is just a wrapper for the original by adding a new item to the and displaying the contents of the . 最后，代码示例创建一个数组大于集合在指定的位置，并使用方法将集合中的元素插入到数组的中间。Finally, the code example creates an array larger than the collection and uses the method to insert the elements of the collection into the middle of the array. remarks.format: ## Remarks 在创建只读集合后，该集合不允许添加、移除或修改元素。A collection that is read-only does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created. 集合是只读的是只是一个集合与防止集合; 进行修改的包装因此，如果对基础集合进行更改，只读集合将反映这些更改。A collection that is read-only is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents modifying the collection; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, the read-only collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation. 此成员是显式的接口成员实现。This member is an explicit interface member implementation. 它只能在 实例强制转换为 接口时使用。It can be used only when the instance is cast to an interface.

MemberSignature.Value: ReadOnly Property IsSynchronized As Boolean Implements ICollection.IsSynchronized

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示是否同步对 的访问（线程安全）。

span.span: Gets a value indicating whether access to the is synchronized (thread safe).

value.span: 如果对 的访问是同步的（线程安全），则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if access to the is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, .

value.span: 在 的默认实现中，此属性始终返回 。

span.span: In the default implementation of , this property always returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 集合中的默认实现不同步。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 返回可以用于对访问进行同步的对象。 returns an object that can be used to synchronize access to the . 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation. 此成员是显式的接口成员实现。This member is an explicit interface member implementation. 它只能在 实例强制转换为 接口时使用。It can be used only when the instance is cast to an interface.

value.span: 可用于同步对 的访问的对象。

span.span: An object that can be used to synchronize access to the .

value.span: 在 的默认实现中，此属性始终返回当前实例。

span.span: In the default implementation of , this property always returns the current instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator() cil managed
Function GetEnumerator () As IEnumerator Implements IEnumerable.GetEnumerator

summary.span: 返回循环访问集合的枚举数。

span.span: Returns an enumerator that iterates through a collection.

returns.span: 可用于循环访问集合的 。

span.span: An that can be used to iterate through the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` Visual c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏了枚举数的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in Visual C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过的末尾的集合，枚举数定位在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置上，后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举数将失效且不可恢复，而且其行为是不确定的。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 集合中的默认实现不同步。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation. 此成员是显式的接口成员实现。This member is an explicit interface member implementation. 它只能在 实例强制转换为 接口时使用。It can be used only when the instance is cast to an interface.

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示 是否具有固定大小。

value.span: 如果 具有固定大小，则为 ；否则为 。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 具有固定大小的集合在创建之后不能再添加或移除元素，但是允许修改现有元素。A collection with a fixed size does not allow the addition or removal of elements after the collection is created, but it allows the modification of existing elements. 具有固定大小的集合是只是一个集合的包装器防止添加和移除元素;因此，如果对基础集合，包括添加或移除元素，进行更改的固定大小的集合将反映这些更改。A collection with a fixed size is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents adding and removing elements; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, including the addition or removal of elements, the fixed-size collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation. 此成员是显式的接口成员实现。This member is an explicit interface member implementation. 它只能在 实例强制转换为 接口时使用。It can be used only when the instance is cast to an interface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以使用下面的语法通过此属性访问集合中的特定元素：`myCollection[index]`。This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: `myCollection[index]`. C# 语言使用[这](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/this.md)关键字来定义而不是实现索引器属性。The C# language uses the [this](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/this.md) keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the property. Visual Basic 将 实现为默认属性，该属性提供相同的索引功能。Visual Basic implements as a default property, which provides the same indexing functionality. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation. 此成员是显式的接口成员实现。This member is an explicit interface member implementation. 它只能在 实例强制转换为 接口时使用。It can be used only when the instance is cast to an interface.
